newsitem.title: PERU: Peru to receive $51 million World Bank loan.
newsitem.headline: Peru to receive $51 million World Bank loan.

text.p: The Peruvian government said Tuesday it would receive a $51 million loan from the World Bank for poverty relief projects in the highlands.
An Economy Ministry decree in the daily El Peruano said the loan was over 17 years and would be paid in half-yearly quotas from Sept 15, 2001 to March 15, 2014.
The interest rate will be based on the six-month LIBOR rate plus a spread of half a percentage point and "minus or plus an average margin to be determined (by the World Bank)," the decree said.
